items.requirement: Process personal data lawfully, fairly, and transparently.
Provide individuals with clear and transparent information about the processing of their personal data.
Ensure that the processing of personal data has a lawful basis.
Collect and process personal data only for specified, explicit, and legitimate purposes.
Ensure that the processing of personal data is compatible with the purposes for which it was collected.
Collect and process only the personal data that is necessary for the intended purpose.
Ensure that the personal data collected is adequate, relevant, and limited to what is necessary.
Ensure that the personal data is accurate and kept up to date.
Take reasonable steps to rectify or erase inaccurate personal data.
Retain personal data for no longer than necessary for the intended purpose.
Establish retention periods for different categories of personal data.
Implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure the security of personal data.
Protect personal data against unauthorized or unlawful processing, accidental loss, destruction, or damage.
Take responsibility for compliance with the Data Protection Act 2018.
Implement policies, procedures, and documentation to demonstrate compliance.
Conduct data protection impact assessments for high-risk processing activities.
Provide individuals with clear and concise information about how their personal data is processed.
Inform individuals about their rights under the Data Protection Act 2018.
Respond to requests from individuals to access their personal data.
Provide individuals with a copy of their personal data in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format.
Rectify inaccurate or incomplete personal data upon request from the individual.
Ensure that third parties who have received the personal data are informed of the rectification.
Erase personal data when it is no longer necessary for the purpose it was collected or processed.
Comply with requests from individuals to delete their personal data.
Restrict the processing of personal data upon request from the individual.
Inform individuals when the restriction is lifted.
Provide individuals with their personal data in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format.
Facilitate the transfer of personal data to another data controller upon request.

subcategory.name: Rights in Relation to Automated Decision Making and Profiling

items.requirement: Inform individuals about the existence of automated decision-making, including profiling, and its consequences.
Obtain explicit consent or implement suitable safeguards for automated decision-making that produces legal effects or similarly significant effects.
Appoint a Data Protection Officer if required by the Data Protection Act 2018.
Ensure that the DPO has appropriate expertise, support, and independence to carry out their tasks.
Implement privacy by design principles in the development of new processes, products, and services.
Ensure that privacy settings are set to the most privacy-friendly options by default.
Conduct a DPIA for high-risk processing activities.
Involve the DPO in the DPIA process.
Address identified risks and implement necessary measures to mitigate them.
Maintain a record of processing activities conducted under your responsibility.
Include specific information in the record as required by the Data Protection Act 2018.
Implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure the security of personal data processing.
Regularly assess and evaluate the effectiveness of security measures.
Ensure that personal data transferred outside the European Economic Area (EEA) is adequately protected.
Use appropriate transfer mechanisms such as Standard Contractual Clauses or Binding Corporate Rules.
Assess the level of protection provided by the third country and implement additional safeguards if necessary.
Inform individuals about the transfer of their personal data to a third country and the associated risks.
Implement measures to detect and promptly respond to data breaches.
Have procedures in place to assess the risks to individuals' rights and freedoms in the event of a data breach.
Notify the supervisory authority of a data breach without undue delay and, where feasible, within 72 hours.
Notify affected individuals of a data breach if it is likely to result in a high risk to their rights and freedoms.
Respond to subject access requests from individuals.
Provide individuals with access to their personal data and any supplementary information.
Process requests from individuals to rectify or erase their personal data.
Inform third parties about rectification or erasure of personal data, where applicable.
Process requests from individuals to restrict or object to the processing of their personal data.
Inform individuals about the outcome of their requests and any further actions taken.

subcategory.name: Compliance with the Data Protection Act 2018

items.requirement: Comply with the provisions of the Data Protection Act 2018 and any relevant codes of conduct or sector-specific legislation.
Cooperate with the supervisory authority and provide requested information.
Understand the potential sanctions for non-compliance with the Data Protection Act 2018.
Take necessary measures to prevent non-compliance and mitigate risks.
